_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Chanute handles Anhydrous Ammonia which is considered hazardous by the Environmental Protection Agency.  It is our policy to adhere to all applicable Federal and State rules and regulations with regard to storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia.

The owners, management and employees of Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Chanute  are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur the facility is prepared to work with the Chanute Fire Department, Neosho County Sheriff's Department and the Neosho County Local Emergency Planning Committee to mitigate any release and minimize the impact of the release to both people and environment.  The primary activity at this facility is the storage and transfer of fertilizers.  

Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Chanute has implemented the provisions of ANSI K-61 and OSHA 29CFR 1910.111.  OSHA, EPA, DOT and the Kansas Department of Agriculture regularly inspect our facilities. These inspections along with the safety culture and training our employees have been through have helped us achieve an outstanding safety record.  Our employees receive semi-annual on the job training and must be able to demonstrate safe operating procedures before being allowed to handle anhydrous ammonia.  Our employees also receieve certified training from the Kansas Fertilizer and Chemical Association.

Therehave been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five years in excess of the reportable quantity as established by the above listed agencies.

Mid-West Fertilizer, Inc. - Chanute has a written emergency action plan, in accordance with OSHA and the EPA and we report our regulated materials to the Community Right to Know program, the responding Fire Department and the LEPC.  Our safety practices go beyond what the law requires, we do what is good for business and safe for the community and the environment.
